name: St. Anne Line
summary: Anne Line was an English Catholic martyr who was executed for harboring priests during the Elizabethan persecution. After her husband was exiled for his faith, she managed a safe house for priests in London. She was arrested when authorities discovered a Mass being celebrated in her home. She was hanged at Tyburn for her role in protecting Catholic priests. She is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales.
